introduction: The following passage is adapted from Astrophysics in the Modern Era by Dr. Isaac Reynolds (2018).
text: Probing deep space with advanced telescopes, researchers have observed faint celestial bodies that ______ beyond our current classifications, suggesting entire categories of stars remain undiscovered.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Consider whether the plural noun and the verb form agree.
explanation: Choice A is correct because the plural subject bodies pairs with the plural verb exist in present tense. B exists is singular. C were existing is past progressive and less appropriate for a general statement. D existing does not provide a main verb for the clause.
